caption:
Fig. 1. SDS-PAGE of cell-free extracts from M .  trichosporium OB3b during a switch from low to high 
copper medium. Cells were grown in continuous culture on low copper medium (1 p ~ - C u ' + ;  dilution 
rate, 0.04 h-' ; biomass density, 1-6-14 g dry wt 1 - I ) .  The concentration of Cu2+ was raised to 5 PM by 
addition of CuSO, solution to the chemostat and the feed was switched to high copper medium (5 VM- 
Cu?+). Samples were taken at intervals of 3-4 h for analysis of the cell-free extracts by SDS-PAGE. 
Electrophoresis was carried out as described in Methods. The numbers above each track indicate the 
time (h) after the switch to high copper medium. Track A shows the molecular weight markers (mol. wt 
66000,45000,36000,29000,24000,20 100 and 14200) and track B is purified methanol dehydrogenase 
from M .  rrichosporium OB3b (subunit mol. wt 60000).

grown on the low copper medium, although in much lower amounts (Fig. 1).

high copper medium were solubilised using Triton X-100 (0-5%, v/v) or sodium deoxycholate

Time after switch (h) 
Fig. 2. Oxidation of ethyl benzene by M .  trichosporium OB3b during a switch from low to high copper 
medium. Cells were grown in continuous culture on low copper medium (1 p~-Cu*+; 
dilution rate, 
0.04 h-' ; biomass density, 1 6 - 1 4  g dry wt I-'). The concentration of Cu2+ was raised to 10 p~ by addi- 
tion of CuSO, solution to the chemostat and the feed was switched to high copper medium (10 PM- 
Cu'+). Samples (10 ml) were taken at intervals for determination of whole cell ethyl benzene oxidation 
rates. Organisms were incubated with shaking at 30 "C in 250 ml conical flasks in the presence of 
ethyl benzene (10 pl) and sodium formate (20 mM) as a source of reducing equivalents. Products, 
4-hydroxethylbenzene (0) 
and 1 -phenylethanol (e), were analysed as described in Methods.
